titles.title: Columbia Orbiter Memorial Act
Columbia Orbiter Memorial Act
To require the construction at Arlington National Cemetery of a memorial to the crew of the Columbia Orbiter.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on Science, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. H. Rept. 108-62, Part I.
House Committee on Science Granted an extension for further consideration ending not later than April 8, 2003.

action.text: Provisions of Measure Incorporated in H.R.1559, Title III..

bill.summary: 4/8/2003--Reported to House without amendment, Part I. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the House on March 13, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Columbia Orbiter Memorial Act - Directs the Secretary of the Army to construct in Arlington National Cemetery, Virginia, a memorial marker honoring the seven members of the crew of the Columbia Orbiter who died on February 1, 2003, during the landing of space shuttle mission STS-107.Authorizes the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to: (1) accept gifts and donations for that or another memorial or monument to the crew; and (2) transfer any donations accepted to the Secretary for the Arlington National Cemetery memorial.
